reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Recovering from grief back to life with hope
reviews.reviewText: Great plot with characters that bring the story to an amazing culmination. The emotions are real and expressed with compassion for a woman's broken life. Also loved the beach setting.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The book was an easy read and written well.....it flowed thru each chapter without any problems. It did not keep my interest because I like more mystery and suspense in my books. I would rather watch a Hallmark movie than read one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great beach Read
reviews.reviewText: Loved this book !!! Perfect book for relaxing and a beautiful story

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful Story of Hope and Love
reviews.reviewText: This was such a great story… if you believe in symbols from your loved ones in Heaven this is the book you need to read

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Do you believe in luck?
reviews.reviewText: What a beautiful story of the depths of grief and loss turning into a new life of happiness and love. Lauren is a hugely successful New York wedding planner living the good life of wealth, happily engaged to the lobe of Jer life. Out of no where a drunk driver smashes into him instantly taking his life. Consumed with grief, life becomes one sleepless night after another. Gone is her joy. Hopeless, she sells her company and TV show and leaves for a small coastal town in North Carolina where they had planned to honeymoon. Not trusting her self to enjoy the lovely Southern town she is surprised to agree to work in an old inn, and, moreover, to plan a quick wedding. Drawn into a circle of Wells meaning friends, she begins collecting sea glass. Each piece has a color that brings a thought of all she has lost. To her amazement she meets an older man who introduces his story which speaks to her grief and an experience that fascinates the whole town. You will be amazed, filled with understanding and grief, that will stun you. And, you will love Milton.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Enthralled until the last chapter
reviews.reviewText: I absolute loved this book. It meets many people’s needs. It was written in a touching way. I could relate until the very last chapter when she goes off for 6 months and did not get married before she left. I guess I’m old fashioned but it would have been perfect if she had ridden off into the sunset, married. I guess young people don’t feel a need for marriage anymore. How very sad.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Magical Surprise Story of Finding Love and Family
reviews.reviewText: I loved everything about this story from the OBX setting to characters you will fall in love with entertained with romance and family!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Loved the Twist at the End, but the Grieving was Unrealistic
reviews.reviewText: I was excited to read a new author other than the Lauren K. Denton, and was really overall disappointed at this Hallmark-movie feel of a story.I find it hard to believe that a woman who was engaged to a man she's known for 4 years can so quickly move into another relationship after only ONE year of mourning. I was kinda urked me when I was literally in the first 20 pages of the book that she's getting all hot and bothered by Brody.Maybe I'm too old fashioned, but really didn't feel any real love between these two main characters.
A good read by this author

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Bitter and sweet, twists and turns ,really kept me wondering what was coming next.I thoroughly enjoyed it and so will you.
Nice story hard to put down

reviews.reviewTitle: A hidden gem of a story!
reviews.reviewText: If you've ever lost someone, and didn't know how to go on, this wonderful tale of resilience, kindness and love will touch a very special place in your heart. And if you haven't ever experienced a loss like that, this will tell you an uplifting and beautiful story about family, friendship and healing. Don't miss out on this! Jenny Hale is a wordsmith and story master!
Loved the story line and the details woven throughout. Easy enjoyable read, and I shed a tear. My kind of book!
